content: PSA: You can now use a shorter form of @rustbot modify labels to ... -- the new form is @rustbot label ..., which I added in triagebot#950.

Is it possible to add other shorthands? For example I quite like people using the bot to switch a PR between waiting-for-author and waiting-for-review, because it sends a notification. But the bot invocation for this is quite long, so I tend to just change the labels via GH's UI so I do not have to type the label names.
Maybe there could be something like @rustbot status=waiting-for-author or just @rustbot waiting-for-author or so, that cleans the old status flag and sets the new one? Figuring out which ones to clear could be tricky though.
What about @rustbot review and @rustbot author? Those are the most common ones and are likely to be set by "non-org contributors"

From a triagebot perspective where "everything is feature", I could imagine a status feature that provides those commands and can be configured like:

[status]
review = "S-waiting-on-review"
author = "S-waiting-on-author"
# etc...
I would be on board with supporting any / all of those suggestions :)
Personally I think something like RalfJ's suggestion would be better; @rustbot review makes it sound like you're trying to review something.
Something @rustbot status=needs-review seems fine or even @rustbot status=review, though I think the first is clearer.
